channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 8th June
item.description:
This is the 2nd time, it looks like it has been collected and dumped in the entrance of the garages. The last time a homeless guy was dragging everything down there. It wasn't there yesterday. Not sure if it is the same person as it makes no sense to dump it there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steedman Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed bin, lots of nappies and full - 4 weeks of hot weather!, 8th June
item.description:
Bin at this exact location not collected on Thursday 5th June 2025. It is full with nappies and could it please be collected especially with hot weather due - would be very grateful!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Macoma Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking, 8th June
item.description:
Empty vehicle parked up blocking a cycle path. It has been here for a few hours now, and it has been observed parked here at least 3 times in the past week

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black painted Lamp Post on exit from subway in out at night, 8th June
item.description:
Black Lamppost on exit from subway with council "Cyclists Dismount" sign on it has been out for a many months. A previous report was closed stating it was a Network rail responsibility. Network rail have repaired theirs in the same area but this one is still not working. Given this posts colour is the same as the other council lamp posts in the area and it had local authority style signage it would indicate itâ€™s the local authorities responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenwood Close, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of trees om the side of our road . Mays Hill Road from House number 21 to 25., 8th June
item.description:
It is very green tree filled road of our council . Apart from the small strip of about 50 meters, we have full of tress. But in front of house number 21-25 Mays Hill Road, there no single tree . It looks like a big gap of baron land. we are happy to water and look after the trees if you can plant it. We love environment to be green with a tree lined street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): May's Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Little stones on cycle track, 8th June
item.description:
There is a load of little tarmac stone residue pebbles on the cycle track running parallel to A206 from Iron Mill lane to Perry street. These little pebbles are sharp and could damage bicycles, cars and also mothers pushing their babies on the pedestrian track which runs alongside the cycle track. This problem has been there at least six months, and it is strange this has not been cleaned by now Please support this plight to get the cycle track clean and kept safe. Thankyou !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
